text: Which of the following statements is/are correct about a large number of ARP request and reply messages? (a) A large number of ARP request and reply messages may slow down the switching process, leading the switch to make many changes in its MAC table. (b) The ARP request is sent as a broadcast, and will flood the entire subnet. (c) All ARP request messages must be processed by all nodes on the local network in the network layer. (d) The network may become overloaded because ARP reply messages have a very large payload due to the 48-bit MAC address and 32-bit IP address that they contain.
